body: I clenched my teeth and envisioned a future where I was talking to her, discovering where the truth was supposed to be, piecing her mess back together until we could both pretend it didn’t happen. That was I should do: make the gentler of the two mistakes. But, I wasn’t made for this kind of attention. It wasn’t my job to help her. That close to freedom, I couldn’t begin trying to <CHOICE(0)> myself

options.true: "You’re disgusting." Her jaw dropped. I could see tears coming to her eyes, and, though her mouth moved as if to say something, she couldn’t manage a sound.
"I thought you said you'd already read it," Her entire body tensed up, shoulders pinched as her eyes shot into the space beside me and her voice went thick with disappointment, <VARIABLE(saidLiked)>
options.false: "I--" Grace pursed her lips, her voice thick with disappointment and trying to keep her chin from shaking. She might as well have been sentenced to life in prison, "C--Can we talk about it?"

options.true: "I thought you said you liked it!"
options.false: "I know it wasn't perfect, but--but you can't just go!"
